item.description:
Post 390 is a new establishment that got rave reviews, for both food and service, in a recent Improper Bostonian article.

Its fare runs the gamut from inexpensive to elaborate. See the menu here:

www.post390restaurant.com

The restaurant is conveniently located in Copley Square. There ought to be on-street parking, and it is accessible by Green Line. There is a huge parking garage a few doors upstream on St. James St, but it's not cheap.

From CitiBuzz:

"Ever felt like you needed a drink while at the post office? ... Situated at the site of the former Back Bay Post Office Annex, this place boasts killer views, an impressive beer and wine selection, and super-chic clientele."

For many more reviews, see:
http://www.yelp.com/b...
item.how_to_find_us: Ask the hostess for the Meetup group
item.name: Post 390: High class under the Hancock
